title: What is the difference between Mor lam and Luk thung (Thai music)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Morlum will has a sense of traditional instruments, Luk Thung literally means Child of the field, so the lyrics is related to Child of the field life, it might be like I’m poor girl from Isan and comes to work in Bangkok. Oh, Bangkok is so civilized, but I miss my serene hometown blah blah. Luk Thung sounds more modern but how they sing with Isan dialect and style made Luk Thung differs from other kinds of song. I will show you some examples and then you will know the differences. You need to listen to the melody. Sometimes Morlum and Luk Thung can be mixed! So, don’t be serious. Actually, I think Thais these days count any songs that use Isan dialect as a Luk Thung. lol Morlum (หมอลำ) is Lao culture. The important instrument is Can (แคน). The original version will has one male and one female singers.  Morlum has many sub-genres. The modern one can be mixed with Western instruments.   Luk Thung was born in Bangkok after WWII.    Thai meme song - Jeehoy!! Luk Thung songs always give me an energy, these are some of my favs. Actually, the lyrics are nothing but its melody is good.

Mor lam is one of a traditional Isaan Thai music. And Luke thung means country music -Luk thung could be music from any part of Thailand regardless southern region, northern region or north eastern region or middle region etc.
